block.p: Patricia Ann Smith, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James P. Smith of Englewood, N.J., was married yesterday to Daniel Francis Barrett, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Christopher S. Barrett of West Hartford, Conn. The Rev. Joseph P. Parkes, the president of Fordham Preparatory School in the Bronx, performed the ceremony at St. Mary of the Assumption Roman Catholic Church in Deal, N.J.
Mr. and Mrs. Barrett, both 29, graduated from the College of the Holy Cross, where they met.

Patricia Ann Smith, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James P. Smith of Englewood, N.J., was married yesterday to Daniel Francis Barrett, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Christopher S. Barrett of West Hartford, Conn. The Rev. Joseph P. Parkes, the president of Fordham Preparatory School in the Bronx, performed the ceremony at St. Mary of the Assumption Roman Catholic Church in Deal, N.J.
Mr. and Mrs. Barrett, both 29, graduated from the College of the Holy Cross, where they met.

The bride is a reporter for WWLP, the NBC television affiliate in Springfield, Mass. Her father is a clinical professor of medicine at the Weill Medical College of Cornell and a pulmonary specialist practicing in Manhattan.

The bridegroom is a director of stock sales and research in New York for UBS Warburg, the investment bank. His father retired as a regional marketing manager at Aetna, the insurance company, in Hartford. The bridegroom is a great-grandson of Christopher Sullivan, who was a member of the House of Representatives from the Lower East Side of Manhattan from 1917 to 1941.
